title: Tourist arrivals up 20% YoY in August
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism industry extended its recovery in August, with arrivals climbing 20.4 percent from a year earlier, led by strong inflows from India, the official data showed.

title: Colombo Port container volumes surge in July
byline: The Port of Colombo reported a significant surge in container handling in July 2025, marking a strong rebound with a double-digit growth, driven by a robust recovery in transshipment volumes.

title: Tea prices rise in August but trail 2024 levels
byline: Sri Lanka’s national tea sales average rose in August from the previous month, helped by stronger prices across all elevations, though the values remained slightly lower compared with a year earlier, the state-run Tea Board said yesterday.

title: Opposition politicians coming together to save themselves: SF
byline: Opposition politicians have come together to save themselves as they are being charged for corruption, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka said.

title: Spanish lady says ’no’, youth say ’yes’
byline: Three tour guides have been arrested and remanded for allegedly sexually abusing and assaulting a 31-year-old Spanish woman while she was dancing with her boyfriend at a DJ party in Kalpitiya.

title: Sri Lanka set to make conciliatory approach
byline: Sri Lanka is seeking a conciliatory approach with the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) this time under the National People’s Power (NPP) government, with the promise to take steps for reconciliation and addressing allegations related to rights violations through a domestic mechanism with international assistance, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Australian fast bowler Starc retires from T20 international cricket
byline: Prolific Australian fast bowler Mitchell Starc announced his immediate retirement from T20 international cricket on Tuesday, saying he wanted to focus on his Test and ODI career.

title: Govt to recruit over 500 officers for Prisons Department
byline: The government has approved the recruitment of 554 officers to the Prisons Department in order to address the shortage of staff.

title: Racial political trends re-emerging in north, south: President
byline: Racial political trends have started to re-emerge in the north and south for defeated politicians to protect their lost power, President Anura kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Rapper arrested with explosives
byline: Popular rapper Madhava Prasad, known as ’Madhuwa’ was arrested today by the Kahathuduwa Police with a stock of explosives in his possession.

title: Grade 5 exam results expected this week
byline: The results of this year’s Grade 5 Scholarship Examination are expected to be released before the end of the week, Examinations Department Commissioner General A.K.S. Indika Kumari Liyanage said.

title: No change in domestic Litro gas prices
byline: Litro Gas Lanka Ltd today announced that there will be no revision in the price of domestic gas for the month of September.

title: Namal calls for unity between UNP and SJB
byline: MP Namal Rajapaksa said it would be beneficial for the United National Party (UNP) and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) to unite, noting that every government in history has collapsed due to internal conflicts.

title: Heavy rains expected after 2 pm today
byline: The Department of Meteorology has forecast light showers in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as in Galle, Matara, Kandy, and Nuwara Eliya districts today.

title: At least 1,000 killed in Sudan landslide, armed group says
byline: A landslide has killed at least 1,000 people in the remote Marra Mountains in western Sudan, according to the armed group the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army.

title: Bribery Commission launches new WhatsApp number for complaints
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption has introduced a new WhatsApp number — 077 777 1954 — for the public to easily report bribery and corruption incidents.

title: Plans to renovate Fort Railway Station at a cost of Rs. 1.3 billion
byline: Plans are afoot to renovate the Colombo Fort Railway Station at a cost of Rs. 1.3 billion funded by the Asian Development Bank (ADB), the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation announced.

title: Sri Lanka, Israel discuss issues in recruitment of nurses and hotel workers
byline: Special attention has been given to enforcing the law against fraudulent intermediaries involved in the recruitment of Sri Lankan nurses to Israel, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment Arun Hemachandra said.

title: CAA seizes unsafe cosmetics and chocolates in Pettah
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) seized unauthorized cosmetics and improperly labelled food items during a series of raids in Pettah.

title: Katchatheevu island to be opened to tourists?
byline: Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources Minister Ramalingam Chandrasekar has said that a feasibility study is underway on a proposed tourism development project to connect Neduntheevu and Katchatheevu.

title: Belgium to recognise Palestinian state at UN General Assembly
byline: Belgium will recognise a Palestinian state at the U.N. General Assembly, Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot said on Tuesday, adding to international pressure on Israel after similar moves by Australia, Britain, Canada and France.

title: UNP can join SJB as an ally: Nalin Bandara
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and the United National Party (UNP) can join the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) and work as one of its allies, an SJB MP said today.

title: New facility for elephants in musth at Pinnawala
byline: The Department of National Zoological Gardens, Dehiwala announced that a special facility is being built at the Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage to house elephants during their musth periods.

title: GMOA launches strike at Ratnapura Teaching Hospital
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) began a symbolic strike at the Ratnapura Teaching Hospital today.

title: Plans afoot to allocate 50,000 acres of suitable land for industries: Industries Ministry
byline: Plans are in place to allocate 50,000 acres of suitable land for industries across the island, Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development said.

title: Italy’s Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Italy’s Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Maria Tripodi, will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka from September 3 to 5, 2025, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: China’s Xi hosts ’old friend’ Putin, North Korea’s Kim in challenge to West
byline: China’s President Xi Jinping convened his Russian and North Korean counterparts in Beijing for the first time on Tuesday, a show of solidarity with countries shunned by the West over their role in Europe’s worst war in 80 years.

title: SL in essential need for new climate laws to save economy: Sajith
byline: Sri Lanka is in essential need of new climate related laws to reduce the anticipated adverse impact on its climate, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: 100 railway stations across the country to be renovated
byline: The first phase of the national programme ’Dream Destination’, which aims to renovate 100 railway stations across the country, was launched today at the Talpe Railway Station under the patronage of Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways Prasanna Gunasena.

title: Sri Lankan’s photo shines at wildlife awards
byline: Sri Lankan wildlife photographer Lakshitha Karunarathna’s photograph “Toxic Tip” has been selected among the 100 award-winning entries at the Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition, organised for the 61st time by the Natural History Museum in London.

title: NPP forcefully takes over FLSP office in Yakkala: FLSP alleges
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has forcefully taken over the Frontline Socialist Party (FLSP) office in Yakkala, located in the Gampaha District, FLSP Education Secretary Pubudu Jayagoda alleged today.

title: SLCERT warns public of fake job scam
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT) warned the public to be cautious of fake job scams that promise high salaries for minimal work.

title: Video shows how gun was hidden in legal book to kill Ganemulla Sanjeewa
byline: A newly emerged video has revealed the method used to smuggle the firearm into the Aluthkade Magistrate’s Court that was used in the killing of underworld figure Ganemulla Sanjeewa.

title: UNP convention postponed
byline: The United National Party (UNP) convention which was to be held on Saturday (September 6) has been postponed, UNP General Secretary Thalatha Athukorala said today.

title: Namal slams NPP for using violence against rivals
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa has accused the National People’s Power (NPP) of resorting to violence and intimidation against other political parties.

title: Suspect arrested over plot to assassinate ‘Harak Kata’ inside court
byline: A suspect who allegedly planned to assassinate underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka, alias Harak Kata, while disguised as a journalist inside court premises, has been arrested by police.

title: Dawoodi Bohra community donate IT equipment to Puttalam Hospital
byline: The Dawoodi Bohra community in Sri Lanka, as part of a community welfare project, donated computer equipment to the Judicial Medical Officer’s (JMO) office at the Base Hospital, Puttalam.

title: Minor forced to endure Nai Miris extract torture: SC rules police officer violated Fundamental Rights
byline: The Supreme Court held that the former Acting Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Hatharaliyadda Police Station had violated the Fundamental Rights of a 16-year-old boy by subjecting him to wrongful arrest, torture and unlawful detention.

title: New scanning machines installed at BIA Customs
byline: Two scanning machines worth Rs. 50 million were installed this afternoon at the arrival terminal of the Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake.

title: Profit-taking drags CSE down
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a negative note today, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) declining by 71.78 points (-0.34%) to settle at 20,990.67, while the S&P SL20 shed 43.75 points (-0.72%) to close at 6,027.61.

title: Five suspects including Kehelbaddara Padme detained for 90 days
byline: Police have obtained detention orders to hold and interrogate five individuals, including Kehelbaddara Padme and Commando Salintha, for a period of 90 days.

title: Govt explores measures to boost local dairy industry
byline: The government has initiated talks with state and private sector stakeholders to strengthen Sri Lanka’s dairy industry, aiming to meet local milk demand and tap into export opportunities.

title: Indonesian police use tear gas on university campuses in ongoing protests
byline: Indonesian police have used tear gas on crowds of protesters near two universities, student groups and authorities said, amid ongoing nationwide protests targeting government spending, and burgeoning fury following a motorcycle taxi driver’s death after being hit by a police car.

title: Oppression of war heroes: SLPP writes to Mahanayake Theras
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has written to the Mahanayake Theras of the Asgiriya and Malwathu Chapters, expressing concern over what it alleges are government attempts to “oppress war heroes.”

title: Civil Intelligence Front alleges $3M fraud in police STF vehicle deal
byline: The Civil Intelligence Front today alleged that a serious fraud amounting to USD 3 million took place in 2017 during the import of Armoured Personnel Carriers (APCs) for the Police Special Task Force (STF).
